Ptosis can be :

*neurogenic'' by paralysis of the III, or by paralysis of the cervical sympathetic (Claude-Bernard-Horner syndrome: association of ptosis-myosis-enophthalmos).
*myogenic'' due to damage to the levator muscle of the upper eyelid: myasthenia, congenital ptosis.
*senile'' due to relaxation of the levator aponeurosis.
*traumatic'' due to rupture of the levator aponeurosis

question.title: What is the primary cause of ptosis?

option_a.title: Relaxation of the levator aponeurosis with age
option_a.description: A common cause of ptosis in older adults

option_b.title: Paralysis of the III cranial nerve and cervical sympathetic
option_b.description: A condition known as Claude-Bernard-Horner syndrome

option_c.title: Damage to the levator muscle of the upper eyelid

option_d.title: Rupture of the levator aponeurosis due to trauma
